column4: Hey people. I'm just looking for someone to help me get started on Ubuntu
anyone help?
Can anyone in here help me get started with Ubuntu? I'm d/l-ing it now, and have a feeling I'm way over my head. :(
troubleshooting before you install?
over vista or alongside it
first step is to md5 the iso; let me get you a link
you need to read the links
is this wireless or wired
once you have md5'd the iso (see bot link above) and burned the iso at low speed to cd, booted into livecd then we can determine how much troubleshooting you really need
never used daemon tools; for checking compatibility it should be okay as long as you can do it ##windows for more info on that
by all means go for it; best to be wired though when you do so unless you know your wireless chipset right now
well that tells us very little; best to be wired then and we can examine from live cd
that is the non-install part of the cd that lets you shop before you buy (in a manner of speaking); you look at the features and then can choose to install or not.
it will give us a clue on how easy it will be to setup wireless
you wont be able to install from the mount like afaik
to mount sure, to install likely not
best to see it before you really install (btw it will be quite a bit slower that way)
same as on eeepc; will work with a bit of fiddling
please dont curse
best way to troubleshoot in that case is connect via a second machine (if you can) and do it that way
good luck then; you are choosing the very most difficult path to follow (on what not need be).
your install was awfully fast; this was via wubi or daemon tools mounted iso
how long did the install process take?
